data.value: We've been attacked! Has the box been opened!?
That depends. Did your box have a lot of flying monsters inside it?
How would I know? I've never opened the box. Never ever. Except... except once... I think it's what made me this way, maybe...
Okay... well, I doubt your box had anything to do with this, Reed. Still, I'll keep my eyes open.
Oh, my box... where is my box? Do you have my box? I must have it back! Find it! Please!
Not you! Listen, do you hear it? Can you hear its whispers locked within? Within the box... My box...
You! You're perfect!
I... don't hear anything.
I can hear its whispers coming from below! Down, deep down in the earth. If you're ever down there, please! You must find my box and return it at once! And whatever you do - do NOT open the box!
Um... thanks?
Well of course you don't! My box has been lost! Somebody must have stolen it! Perhaps it was that Moska fellow, he's always averting his gaze from me, like he's hiding something.
Okay, Reed. If I find your box underground, I'll be sure to bring it back.
Probably his distaste for your nuttiness.
I will never let it out of my sight again. It is my burden to bear, after all. Good luck, Dust.
Yes, well... you keep that box under lock and key. We're just lucky that kid down in Mudpot had the common sense not to open it.
Well, it did, didn't it? So now I have no use for this Revival Stone and you can take it. Hopefully you never have to use it.
Wait, what do you mean 'If your plan didn't work'?
I am glad that's the case. Anyway, I was planning on using this Revival Stone on you if my plan didn't work, but it should still serve as an adequate reward.
You were right, Reed - somehow that killing blow managed to shake the presence free. I'm back to my normal self again.
I... think so, yeah. As soon as I took that killing blow I felt something, like a weight lifted. We should check in with Reed.
Did that do it? Are you okay, now?
Yeah, the sooner you get rid of that box, the better!
Dust, you can't seriously be considering-!
If you do it in time, the presence latched to your soul will be shaken loose and return to the box, and you will return back to your normal self. That is, assuming you do it in time.
Reed!
In other words, Dust, you will need to kill yourself.
The presence inside the box... it latches onto your soul, tries to take over your mind. The only way to stop it is to break the barrier between body and soul.
Look, let's not dwell on the whole 'Who opened the box' thing. The box was opened. That's in the past. We can't change that. We should be focusing on the future and, you know, less about me.
Travel outside the village, pick a fight with some monsters... and lose.
Shut up, Fidget. I can feel my life draining away every moment... Reed, what do I have to do?
You know what? I love this plan. I'm happy to be a part of it.
It really is the only way, Dust. You mustn't take too long or... or you could end up like me.
Fidget, I don't have time to argue! I can feel it draining my life away. We need to get out of the village, and fast!
Then it's already started! Oh, why did you have to open the box? I said not to open the box!
Reed! What was that? What's going on? I feel... I feel weak! Like something's sucking the life right out of my body!
Okay, Reed, I really think it's time you went inside and got some sleep. I think... wait... what's happening to me? There's something... something wrong with me!
I'll say! They told me the box was filled with cupcakes. I opened it up, and nothing was inside!
Relax, Reed. It's just a box.
Just a box? No... no, it's not just a box. Didn't you hear it whispering to you? The whispers... the lies...
Do you know what you've done? You've unleashed the power inside this ancient prison, and now it will consume your very soul!
You've found it! Quickly, give it to me!
Hey, what are you doing? I thought you wanted your box back? I went through a lot of trouble getting that!
Yeah! We had to find this girl in Mudpot, and then make her a doll that looked like me, then trade the doll for the box! Honestly, it was a bit roundabout.
Oh! Oh no. No, no... you opened the box! Why did you open the box!? I told you not to open the box! Quick! Take it back! I can't hold this!
What else whispers to me? No... no it can't be. The trees? The trees themselves whisper in ancient song! Somebody must chop them all down to silence their lies!
Goodbye, Reed.
No, Reed.
I looked up into the sun today. It told me to destroy all the toothbrushes. It's just not natural! Dust, you can help me! We must stop the toothbrushes before they stop US!
